Articles.Content:
Those boats....

So beautiful.

The independence was also loaded with guided missiles.

I call it a draw.

I have a wild card HMS Warspite. She's a QEII modified to carry 6 AGMs, repositioned engines, and a sleek underbody, for top speed of 33 m/s. And she's still indestructible. Amazingly, she's still almost the exact same part count and weight as the origional. That means i did something right

Captain Caloly Kerman, the first Commander of HMS Warspite.

Edited November 4, 2014 by zekes
33 m/s is 64 knots seeks That warship is faster than most if not all of today's warships
That's because it's small and light compared to a real warship.

I have a wild card HMS Warspite. She's a QEII modified to carry 6 AGMs, repositioned engines, and a sleek underbody, for top speed of 33 m/s. And she's still indestructible. Amazingly, she's still almost the exact same part count and weight as the origional. That means i did something right

http://i.imgur.com/KKxVBN6.jpg

Captain Caloly Kerman, the first Commander of HMS Warspite.

http://i.imgur.com/YNcOXJp.jpg

Don't forget the independence and all of my naval warships have VTOL landing pads.

My DDG-51 also carries 6 missiles. 2 Harpoons and 4 VLS AS-ROC missiles.

(And under 800 parts. Those are an awful lot of intakes on the QE. )

Javascript is disabled. View full album

I also had 12 VLS ESSM missiles in the front VLS launch cells (For a total of 18 missiles), but the part count approached 900. Guess I'll put them back in to improve the air warfare aspect.

There's so much empty deck space in the front... I have no idea what to put there... for now.

NOTE: The DDG-51 is a return to all steel superstructures in KATEC's naval shipbuilding. Our prototypes were cute balsa wood replicas (aka aluminum) but after the Spruance Hulls demonstrated excessive metal fatigue, we decided to use a stronger alloy.

...Polar covalent, covalent, ionic, anion, cation, alloy... 'insane laughing'.

EDIT: Harpoon missile flight trials have proved... promising...

Jebediah stands solemnly on the wreckage of the JMSDF Takeshima after suffering a carrier killer missile strike.

Javascript is disabled. View full album

The Perry... Still works?!?!

YES! I still have a nearly invincible warship.

Javascript is disabled. View full album

EDIT: Actually, the harpoon is starting to scare me...

I'm thinking of making a new capital ship, PGN Deliverance.

-snip-

I want to see what harpoons do against a QE.... can you fling some at it? DL is in my sig. I doubt she will take too much damage.

Also, it's got room for some .5m missile boxes up on the amidships, and I'm going to rework the turret weapons.

edit: I just added 6 of spartwo' mini guided missiles to the upper AA deck... Will post pics later

Edited November 4, 2014 by zekes
I can only attack once per tour, ok; but by attack, what do you mean? am i allowed to fire multiple missile froma single ship to a single target

I can only attack once per tour, ok; but by attack, what do you mean? am i allowed to fire multiple missile froma single ship to a single target

Yup, the way we play it, you can empty all magazines inside the 2.5km sphere, move the ship away (which helps wonders with lag), then run all the missile attacks one by one. You wouldn't be able to re-arm and try again, though, or salvage midway into the attack: once you start attacking with a ship, you can't use any other until you have finished the attack of the turn. I think. That means guided missiles are more useful than unguided torpedoes... which IMO makes all the sense in the world.

Rune. At least that's how I read the rule.

I can only attack once per tour, ok; but by attack, what do you mean? am i allowed to fire multiple missile from a single ship to a single target

Basically, each turn you may fire upon one enemy ship, but once you finish your attack (either by choice or running out of ammo on your vessel), you must move off and/or end your turn.

Don't forget: ships move in order of tonnage. (A small fighter will move before a large cruiser.)

EDIT: Forgot to mention, you can move any of your ships around as much as you want in each turn, but you may only attack one ship each turn, and with only one of your ships. Once that's done, your turn's over.

Hmm, I have a few ship designs, I'd need to modify them and fix them up, but I think they'd make for a fun battle. Just wondering, how do submarines fit into all this? As far as I can tell, they'd be immune to pretty much everything.

They're allowed, but difficult to make.

Also, the 'Victory' Class Mk-IV is finished! And she's the first ship to fly the new Trafalgar flag! (Credit to Vagani for the flag).

Pros: Flies the new flag, higher D/V, unbelievably strong, more accurate missiles, less weight, less parts, better looking.

Cons: Slightly lower TWR.

hey! That looks good! I can't wait to see it out at sea.

EDIT: why is everyone making helipads on the back of their ships? I haven't really found a good use for air-sea support, especially with ships that can carry their own AA missiles. Planes just can't deal the kind of damage needed to knock out big ships; and minimissiles are far more effective for killing smaller vessels.

I have completed my proto-fleet; does anyone wish to battle? Standard rules, 5 five ships or 175 tons, belligerent chooses the theater. I do warn that my ships have rather high part counts, but if you are fine with some lag, then it is irrelevant...Considering that this will be my first battle, and I shall be using otherwise untested ships, I shall probably die horribly, but I must begin somehow.

So, any takers?

I can't, for the simple fact that I don't have any ships anywhere near 35 tonnes Sorry

Curse your overly-armored vessels. All of my ships seem to be super-light compared to everyone else's, probably because I use intakes and wings rather than girders and plates...Battling you would probably have resulted in my instant death, anyway, considering that you are undefeated against far more experienced opponents. Anyone else?
